summary: As a university graduate from Trinidad and Tobago moving to Barbados, you may apply for a CARICOM Skills Certificate and verify it with the Barbadian Competent Authority.
notes: You must hold a recognized university degree from an accredited institution.
You can enter Barbados to seek work without a work permit once you have a valid Skills Certificate.
Free movement of skills does not grant automatic permanent residency or citizenship.
You must comply with immigration requirements in Barbados at all times.
checklist: Official transcript (if required by host country)
competentAuthorityHint: Confirm the current Competent Authority for Barbados on the official government website.

summary: Qualified teachers from Trinidad and Tobago can apply for a Skills Certificate to work in Guyana under free movement of skills.
notes: You must provide proof of teaching qualifications and professional registration where applicable.
You do not require a separate work permit once your Skills Certificate is accepted by Guyanese authorities.
You still need to follow Guyanaâ€™s immigration rules for length and type of stay.
checklist: Proof of teacher registration or license (if applicable)
competentAuthorityHint: Verify which Ministry or agency in Guyana acts as the Competent Authority for teachers.
